usefulItems: small bowl , 12-hole muffin tray, 12 cupcake liners, wooden skewer, wire rack, oven
title: Lemon and lime polenta cakes

ingredients.content: 2 lemons, zest (no white pith) and juice
1 lime, zest (no white pith) and juice
200 g butter, cut into pieces (2 cm)

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 160°C. Line a 12-hole muffin tray with paper cases and set aside.
Place polenta, sugar and citrus zests into mixing bowl and mill <b>30 sec/speed 9<b>.
Add butter, vanilla, 1 tablespoon of the lemon juice and 1 tablespoon of the lime juice (see Tips) into mixing bowl and mix <b>10 sec/speed 5<b>.
Add eggs, flour and baking powder and mix <b>10 sec/speed 4<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, folding through any uncombined mixture.

Transfer mixture into prepared paper cases. Bake for 20-25 minutes (160°C), or until a skewer inserted into the centre of the cakes comes out clean. Allow to cool in tin for 5-10 minutes, then transfer onto a wire rack to cool completely before serving.

hintsAndTricks: This recipe uses coarse polenta. Do not use the quick-cooking variety.
If you’re lime doesn’t produce 1 tbsp of juice, then just use extra lemon juice to make up the difference. You need 2 tbsp (40 g) total of citrus juice for these polenta cakes.
